summary: This is an email chain from August 30, 2019, between federal prosecutors discussing a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein. An AUSA in Boston refers a woman who was taken to Epstein's townhouse as a model 20 years prior and has been contacted by David Boies' firm. The recipient prosecutors agree to speak with her.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: His law firm is contacting a potential Epstein victim, causing her confusion, as mentioned by an AUSA in Boston.

connections.description: David Boies' firm is contacting a potential Epstein victim, indicating they are representing or seeking to represent her.

events.title: Model taken to Epstein's townhouse
events.description: Approximately 20 years prior to the email, a model was taken to Jeffrey Epstein's townhouse in NYC one night; the exact events are unclear but something happened.

events.title: Prosecutor referral of potential victim
events.description: An AUSA in Boston contacts other federal prosecutors to refer a potential Epstein victim for assistance, as she is confused by contact from David Boies' firm.

keyFacts: A potential Epstein victim, a model in NYC about 20 years ago, was taken to Epstein's townhouse one night where 'something happened.'
The victim has been contacted by David Boies' law firm, and she is confused about what to do.
Federal prosecutors in New York are willing to speak with this potential victim following a referral from an AUSA in Boston.
The email indicates ongoing coordination among federal prosecutors regarding Epstein victims in August 2019, shortly after Epstein's death.
